intro: Derris canescens, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its roots are notable for containing the alkaloid derrisine, which has been used in traditional medicine. Derris canescens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
